quest.name: A Meating Long Overdue
journal:
 Quest Sync
The unfulfilled forager has a craving for meat.
objectives: Use the wrangling rope on a weakened tragopan.
Deliver the trussed-up tragopan to the unfulfilled forager.

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: Ah, what I wouldn't give for just one mouthful of juicy meat...

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: I've eaten naught but meol for more moons than I can count! I mean, I'm grateful for the handouts and all but sometimes a man needs variety.

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: Aye, if I had me a roasted game bird about now, I'd strip that beauty down to the bone!

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: But have you ever tried catchin' one of them tragopans? It's like askin' to have your eyes pecked out. ...What, you reckon you could do better?

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: Go ahead, then─make me eat my own words. Just so long as they come with a side dish of bird flesh!

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: And make sure you bring it back alive and kickin', you understand? Here's a rope to truss it up, and a sack to carry it. You might need to, uh, daze it a bit first...

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: Once you've knocked the fight out of the bird, you can bind it with that length of rope!

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: Tell me there's a bird in that sack!

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: Oof, that's a feisty one! Nice work, stranger!

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: Ah, seein' this fellow all trussed up for the dinner table reminds me of bein' back in Stilltide...

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: It's been years since I left to chase after Eulmore's promises, but I'm no closer to gettin' through that gate than when I started.

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text: It's been years since I left to chase after Eulmore's promises─I suppose I've just gotten too used to the life here in Gatetown.

dialogue.name: GRIMYMAN03352
dialogue.text:
Maybe it's time I gave up on hollow dreams and went home to my old mum...
Anyway, my thanks for the bird, friend!
